isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Performance Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 14. Crankcase Pressure

svcproc.title: 14. Crankcase Pressure
svcproc.para: PurposeTo measure the condition of the power cylinders

item.para: Magnehelic gauge on gauge bar or water manometer

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para:
See " Appendix A: VT 275 Performance Specifications
" for specifications and record on Diagnostic Form.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, do not allow engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly dispose of clothing or rags containing engine fluids. Engine fluids contain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could cause cancer.

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel, and coolant, are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never dispose of engine fluids in the trash, by pouring them on the ground, in sewers, or in bodies of water.

step1.para: Make sure the engine oil level is not above operating range and the oil level gauge is secured.
Make sure crankcase breather hose is clean and secure in crankcase breather assembly, and make sure the crankcase breather assembly and the valve cover are tight.
Make sure all hoses are secure and not leaking.
Clamp off road draft hose or crankcase breather hose with heater hose pliers.
Remove oil fill cap or oil fill extension tube (on stripped chassis).
Install extended oil fill tube in oil fill cap opening
Install Crankcase Pressure Test Adapter on the extended oil fill tube.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, death, including damage to the engine or vehicle, comply with the following:

item.para: When routing test line, do not crimp line, run line too close to moving parts, or let line touch hot engine surfaces.
Before running engine for diagnostic or service procedures, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels.

step1.para: Connect a test line from the crankcase pressure test adapter to the magnehelic gauge on the gauge bar or to a water manometer.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, use proper ventilation when operating an engine in a closed area, in order to remove deadly exhaust fumes. Inhalation of exhaust fumes may be fatal.

step1.para: Run the engine to reach normal engine operating 70 °C (158 °F) or higher, before measuring crankcase pressure.
Run engine at high idle (no load) rpm. Allow the gauge reading to stabilize before taking pressure reading.
Record crankcase pressure on Diagnostic Form.

item.para:
If pressure is below specification, go to " Test 15. Test Drive (Full load, rated speed)
."
If pressure is above specification, continue with step 13.

step1.para: Do " Test 10. Relative Compression " to pin point suspect cylinders.
Do " Test 9. Injector Disable " to further pin point suspect cylinders.
Inspect air induction for dirt ingestion.
Measure compression with compression test adapter and gauge. Compare compression cylinder to cylinder.

entry.para: High oil consumption and excessive crankcase pressure may indicate
Cylinder sleeves badly worn or scored
Leaking valve seals or worn valve guides
A restricted orifice in crankcase breather tool
